decks.notes: This deck focuses on a fast-paced, aggressive strategy that aims to quickly overwhelm the opponent with low-cost, efficient creatures and disruptive spells. By combining disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push with evasive threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Mockingbird, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain control of the board throughout the game. The inclusion of cards like Spyglass Siren and Brazen Borrower provides additional versatility and disruption, allowing the deck to adapt to different matchups and strategies. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's aggressive game plan and ensure consistent access to the necessary colors of mana.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently deal damage to the opponent using a variety of low-cost spells and aggressive creatures. The deck focuses on maximizing card draw and spell efficiency to maintain pressure on the opponent while also having some control elements to disrupt your opponent's strategy. The deck utilizes cards like Stormchaser's Talent and Cori-Steel Cutter to quickly close out games and overwhelm opponents. Additionally, the deck includes some card recursion with Dreadhorde Arcanist to keep up the pressure and continue to apply threats.

The deck focuses on assembling the Greasefang Parhelion combo to overwhelm the opponent. It includes cards like Monument to Endurance and Parhelion II to support this strategy, along with cards like Fleeting Spirit and Seasoned Hallowblade for protection and additional options. The deck also includes control elements like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a combination of fast mana and consistent card draw, the deck aims to quickly set up its combo pieces and close out the game before the opponent can respond effectively.

This deck focuses on fast and aggressive creature plays with a mix of burn spells to control the board and finish off opponents quickly. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with early creature damage and use direct burn spells to remove any blockers or threats they may have. The deck also utilizes mana-efficient creatures that can grow in power quickly, making it difficult for the opponent to stabilize. Additionally, the deck includes lands that provide both mana fixing and additional damage potential to keep up the pressure on the opponent.

The deck revolves around assembling the Greasefang and Parhelion II combo to dominate the battlefield. It includes cards like Fleeting Spirit and Seasoned Hallowblade to protect the combo pieces, while also using removal like Fatal Push and Vanishing Verse to control the board. The deck utilizes various lands to enable the combo, alongside cards like Thoughtseize and Monument to Endurance to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Overall, the key strategy is to efficiently set up the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with powerful synergies.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly ramp up mana using cards like Arboreal Grazer and Lotus Field, while using cards like Scapeshift and Lumra to combo off and win the game in a single turn. The deck also includes cards for card draw and protection, as well as utility lands like Boseiju, Who Endures and Mirrorpool. The goal is to set up the combo as quickly as possible while controlling the board and out-valuing the opponent.

The deck focuses on utilizing Niv-Mizzet Reborn as a powerful control tool, allowing for a wide range of spells and removal options with the ability to draw cards. The deck includes a variety of Triome lands for color fixing, as well as Bring to Light to fetch important cards from the deck. The inclusion of companions like Yorion, Sky Nomad adds additional versatility to the strategy. Overall, the deck aims to control the board, draw cards, and outvalue the opponent in a slower, grindy game.

The main concept of this UW Control deck is to control the game through strong counterspells, removal, and card advantage. The deck utilizes cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria, Supreme Verdict, and Narset, Parter of Veils to disrupt the opponent's game plan and maintain board presence. The inclusion of Kaheera, the Orphanguard as a companion provides additional synergy and a strong creature option. By efficiently managing threats and resources, this deck aims to outlast its opponent and secure victory through attrition and card advantage.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on using low-cost creatures and burn spells to deal damage quickly and efficiently to the opponent. By deploying aggressive creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage early on and following up with spells like Burst Lightning and Reckless Rage, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent and win the game before they can stabilize. The inclusion of land cards like Den of the Bugbear and Ramunap Ruins allows for additional damage output in the late game if needed.

The deck focuses on aggression and disruption, utilizing powerful creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. It combines aggressive creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester with disruptive cards like Duress and Thoughtseize to control the game and maintain pressure. The deck also utilizes powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to clear the opponent's creatures and keep the board under control. Overall, the deck aims to apply early pressure and disrupt the opponent's game plan while maintaining a strong board presence.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures to deal damage quickly while disrupting the opponent's hand with discard spells like Thoughtseize. It also has removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with opposing threats. The inclusion of cards like Graveyard Trespasser and Ledger Shredder helps to disrupt the opponent's graveyard strategy. The deck relies on a mix of creatures and spells to apply pressure and control the game, aiming to finish off the opponent before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing Greasefang Parhelion as its primary win condition through various support cards such as Monument to Endurance and Parhelion II. It aims to protect its key pieces with cards like Sheltered by Ghosts and Seasoned Hallowblade, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure a smooth and consistent mana curve, with lands like Concealed Courtyard and Godless Shrine providing the necessary colors for casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent for a fast victory.

This Rakdos Aggro deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. The key strategy is to quickly establish a board presence with efficient creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Graveyard Trespasser, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress. The deck also utilizes powerful removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with opposing threats. By applying pressure early and disrupting the opponent's strategy, this deck aims to secure a swift victory in 1 vs 1 matches.

The deck focuses on a powerful synergy between Greasefang, Okiba Boss and Parhelion II, using Monument to Endurance to ramp up to the combo quickly. The deck also includes a mix of control elements such as Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's strategy. Additionally, Seasoned Hallowblade and Guardian of New Benalia provide a strong defensive backbone, while Fleeting Spirit and Sheltered by Ghosts offer additional protection. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its combo pieces efficiently while maintaining control over the game to secure victory.

The deck revolves around utilizing Lotus Field as a key card to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This mana is then used to power out powerful combo pieces such as Scapeshift and Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes ways to protect its combo pieces, such as Boseiju, Who Endures, and Wishclaw Talisman. Overall, the strategy focuses on ramping up mana early in the game to win through a powerful combo finish. The cards in the deck work together to create a consistent and powerful combo deck.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with spells, allowing for the reanimation of Arclight Phoenix and generating card advantage through Treasure Cruise. Utilizing cheap interactive spells and cantrips, while also incorporating a game-winning threat in Arclight Phoenix, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its aggressive playstyle and resource efficiency. The inclusion of Temporal Trespass provides a powerful finisher option, ensuring the deck can maintain pressure and close out games against slower opponents. The deck's synergy between graveyard recursion and card draw enables it to maintain a consistent aggressive strategy throughout the game.
